conclusion: Use the formula F = I * L * B * sin(theta) to calculate magnetic force.
Wire is folded into a right-angle shape with segments ac of length L and cd of length 2L.
Magnetic field B is uniform and perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
Magnetic force on segment ac is F_ac = I * L * B.
Magnetic force on segment cd is F_cd = 2 * I * L * B.
Force F_ac acts horizontally to the right.
Resultant force is F_resultant = sqrt(F_ac^2 + F_cd^2).
Substitute F_ac and F_cd into the resultant force equation.
Simplify to get F_resultant = sqrt(5) * I * L * B.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the wire is F = sqrt(5) * I * L * B.
